intro: Calyptridium parryi var. typicum, commonly known as the Parry's bluebelle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, hairy leaves and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
